etymology.description: 顏(顏) (yán, "face") simplified by 彥(彥) (yàn, "elegant") becoming 彦(彥) (yàn, "elegant") and 頁(頁) (yè, "leaf") becoming 页(頁) (yè, "leaf") -> final form 颜(顏)
etymology.interpretation: The character 颜(顏) (yán, "face") originally included the components 彦(彥) (yàn, "elegant") and 頁(頁) (yè, "leaf"), representing a compound symbolizing an elegant face or appearance. The simplification process retained these meanings by choosing streamlined forms for these components, hence maintaining a connection to the character's original associations.
etymology.simplification: The simplification involved changing 彥(彥) to 彦(彥) as a streamlined design and 頁(頁) to 页(頁), reflecting a wider simplification across characters that shared these components.

examples.chinese: 颜先生今天出席会议(顏先生今天出席會議)。
examples.english: Mr. Yan attended the meeting today.

examples.chinese: 颜的家族历史悠久(顏的家族歷史悠久)，在学术界享有盛誉(在學術界享有盛譽)。
examples.pinyin: Yán de jiāzú lìshǐ yōujiǔ, zài xuéshù jiè xiǎngyǒu shèngyù.
examples.english: The Yan family has a long history, and they enjoy a high reputation in the academic world.
